result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando T Trimble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 5/13/22.
Court will allow for transfer of probation to another jurisdiction, if defendant moves out of State.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
DV assessment imposed, as to both counts.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
Court set restitution at zero.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim unless approved by the court.

AODA assessment; Comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando T Trimble

defendant.name: Trimble, Orlando T
defendant.address: 525 West Bergen Drive, Fox Point, WI 53217

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Orlando T Trimble in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea and sentencing hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 1 AND 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent. 

AS TO COUNT 4: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent. 

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- DV assessment imposed, as to both counts.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 5/13/22.
*Court will allow for transfer of probation to another jurisdiction, if defendant moves out of State.

Received and filed: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.

Attorney Thomas J McClure in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 020214,
Payable Number: 989346,
Receipt Number: 22RP008592,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with DLT (6/1/1969); LEH (6/5/1990); TT (3/19/2009)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Court ordered Defendant provide updated address at next court hearing; also to Justice Point Services.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Orlando T Trimble in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Orlando T Trimble in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Orlando T Trimble appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
